intro: Humbertioturraea decaryana, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula thornveld tree, is a shrub or small tree native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, thorny growth habit. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces yellowish flowers followed by small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Humbertioturraea decaryana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
